intro: Kohautia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved kohautia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, evergreen shrub form. The plant features lanceolate leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring season. Kohautia longifolia is well adapted to the moist, cool environments of its native habitat.
